definitions.definition: connected with the state, government or public affairs

examples.text: He was a **political prisoner** *(= one who was put in prison for holding opinions that the government thought dangerous)*.
The police force is facing intense **political pressure** to reopen the investigation.

definitions.definition: connected with the different groups working in politics, especially their policies and the competition between them

examples.text: Peace organizations are being used as fronts for **political agendas**.
the right to participate in **political processes**.
This whole issue has become highly political.
the first purely political decision taken by the EU
the overtly political works of Leon Golub

definitions.definition: interested in or active in politics

examples.text: She became very political at university.
I'm not a **political animal** *(= person who is interested in politics)*.

definitions.definition: connected with power, status, etc. within an organization, rather than with matters of principle

examples.text: I suspect that he was dismissed for political reasons.
We have no intention of getting political.
